citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the facility did not have an updated written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) and had not
received a regularly scheduled visit from the attending veterinarian (AV) within the past twelve (12) months. In addition,
the PVC did not list the species of animals sold at the facility.
A written Program of Veterinary Care that is current, facility-specific, and inclusive of all animal species maintained is
required to facilitate effective communication between the attending veterinarian and the facility. Failure to maintain an
updated PVC completed in detail by the attending veterinarian prevents APHIS officials from determining whether animals
at the facility are receiving adequate veterinary care or whether acceptable methods are being used to prevent, control,
diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. Additionally, veterinary site visits are required to provide the professional
guidance necessary to optimize the health and welfare of the animals kept at each site.
Each dealer is required to employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements, and in the case of a part-time
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises.
Correct by: January 16,2026.

At the time of the inspection, the licensee failed to maintain required acquisition records for several prairie dogs.
Specifically, the acquisition of fifteen (15) prairie dogs had not been documented. Complete and accurate records are
required to ensure effective animal tracking and to maintain compliance with the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) and its
regulations.
The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully disclose the information concerning animals,
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or
which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor.
Correct by: January 16,2026.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At the time of inspection, the facility did not have an updated written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) and had not 
received a regularly scheduled visit from the attending veterinarian (AV) within the past twelve (12) months. In addition, 
the PVC did not list the species of animals sold at the facility. 
 
A written Program of Veterinary Care that is current, facility-specific, and inclusive of all animal species maintained is 
required to facilitate effective communication between the attending veterinarian and the facility. Failure to maintain an 
updated PVC completed in detail by the attending veterinarian prevents APHIS officials from determining whether animals 
at the facility are receiving adequate veterinary care or whether acceptable methods are being used to prevent, control, 
diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. Additionally, veterinary site visits are required to provide the professional 
guidance necessary to optimize the health and welfare of the animals kept at each site.  
 
Each dealer is required to employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements, and in the case of a part-time 
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary 
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises. 
Correct by: January 16,2026. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
At the time of the inspection, the licensee failed to maintain required acquisition records for several prairie dogs. 
Specifically, the acquisition of fifteen (15) prairie dogs had not been documented. Complete and accurate records are 
required to ensure effective animal tracking and to maintain compliance with the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) and its 
regulations.  
 
The licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully disclose the information concerning animals, 
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or 
which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor.  
Correct by: January 16,2026.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
